intro: Fimbristylis miliacea, commonly known as the millet sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy areas, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or brown in color. It is often used in traditional medicine and can also serve as a food source for wildlife. Fimbristylis miliacea plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and supporting biodiversity.
